definition: to scale (a height)/to ascend/to mount/to publish or record/to enter (e.g. in a register)/to press down with the foot/to step or tread on/to put on (shoes or trousers) (dialect)/to be gathered and taken to the threshing ground (old)

pinyin: deng1 ji1 shou3 xu4 gui4 tai2

sentences.english: AF Flight No.123 is checking in at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 法航123号航班正在办理登机手续。

sentences.english: One stewardess stands at the front cabin door to welcome the Passengers aboard.
sentences.chinese: 一位女乘务员站在机舱门口欢迎乘客登机。

sentences.english: Can I check this stroller at the gate?
sentences.chinese: 我可以在登机门托运婴儿推车吗？

sentences.english: Passengers must go to the waiting lounge before boarding a flight.
sentences.chinese: 登机前，旅客必须先到候机室候机。

sentences.english: When I got there she smiled again, and handed me a boarding pass.
sentences.chinese: 在柜台前她笑容满面地递给我一张登机牌。

sentences.english: Professor Lu Yang stood on the plane's entrance and waved good-bye to us.
sentences.chinese: 陆杨教授站在飞机的登机口前向我们挥手告别。

sentences.english: We are now boarding all rows on Flight 1234 to Columbus.
sentences.chinese: 现在所有乘坐飞往哥伦布第1234航班的乘客登机。

sentences.english: Can I see your boarding pass, please?
sentences.chinese: 能给我看一下您的登机牌吗？

sentences.english: Excuse me. What is the checking-in time here at the airport?
sentences.chinese: 请问，机场什么时候开始检票登机？

sentences.english: Will the future arrangements for the hotel to take you to the airport check-in possible?
sentences.chinese: 请问明天安排酒店送您到机场登机可以吗？

sentences.english: Here's your ticket and boarding pass.
sentences.chinese: 这是你的机票和登机牌。

sentences.english: Flight 088 for Detroit is boarding now.
sentences.chinese: 飞往底特律的088号班机现在开始登机。

sentences.english: However, be informed however when she conducts boarding check and record without passenger ticket .
sentences.chinese: 然而，当她办理登机牌时却被告知并无客票记录。

sentences.english: We check in at the Airport Express station.
sentences.chinese: 我们在机场快线站办理登机手续。

sentences.english: And this is my dear wife at the check-in counter.
sentences.chinese: 这是我亲爱的夫人在登机报到处。

definition: to get off a plane/to deplane
luggage that has been checked in (on flight)
scheduled flight/flight number/plane/scheduled sailing/sailing number/passenger ship
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
